column1: #Text=[0019] Yet other example embodiments of the invention provide methods for fabricating more highly integrated phase change memory devices.
#Text=[0020] An example method according to the invention includes forming a conductive layer on a semiconductor substrate.
#Text=A conformal or molding insulating layer is then formed to cover the conductive layer.
#Text=A via hole exposing a region of the conductive layer is then formed through the molding insulating layer.
#Text=A via filling layer is then formed on the molding insulating layer, and on an inner sidewall and a bottom surface of the via hole.

#Text=A portion of the via filling layer adjacent an upper lip or edge region of the via hole is then removed to form a via filling layer pattern remaining at least on a bottom surface of the via hole.
#Text=The processes of forming the via filling layer and the via filling layer pattern are sequentially and repeatedly performed at least once to form a via plug in the via hole.

#Text=[0021] In the example embodiments detailed herein, the via filling layer may be removed using an ion beam etching process (sometimes referred to as ion milling) in which an energetic ion beam is directed at the via filling layer while inclined at an incident angle with respect to an open axis of the via hole.

#Text=The ion beam will typically be configured with an incident angle sufficient to prevent the ion beam from being directly incident on the bottom surface of the via hole and frequently at least a lower portion of the via hole sidewall.
#Text=As will be appreciated, the range of suitable incident angles will tend to increase as the aspect ratio of the via holes increases.
#Text=Depending on the aspect ratio of the via holes, it is anticipated that ion beams having an incident angle in a range of 30.degree. to 85.degree. may be satisfactory for use in this method.

#Text=[0022] In some example embodiments, the process utilized for removing the portion of the via filling layer formed adjacent the upper lip or edge of the via hole may maintained for a time and under process conditions sufficient to expose a top surface of the molding insulating layer.

#Text=[0023] Alternatively, embodiment of the process may, for example, include a modified version of the ion etching or milling process used to remove an upper portion of the via filing layer formed adjacent the upper lip or edge of the via holes.

#Text=In this alternative embodiment, the ion etch process is terminated before all of the via filling layer has been removed, thereby producing a via filling layer that maintains a reduced thickness on a top surface of the molding insulating layer after the etch.

#Text=In this instance, the portion of the via filling layer that remains on the molding insulating layer at this point in the process may be subsequently removed during final formation of the via filling layer pattern.
